tit.e: Kamigata Rakugo (Comic Storytelling in Kyoto and Osaka)
tit.cmt: 落語家の〜代はすべてI,II, III...で統一しました。名前が列挙される場合が多いので、読みやすさを優先しました。
tit.e: Kamigata Rakugo (Comic Storytelling in Kyoto and Osaka)
Kamigata Rakugo (Comic Storytelling in Kyoto and Osaka)

sen.j: 上方落語（かみがたらくご）とは、大阪府・京都府を中心とする地域で主に演じられる落語。
sen.e: Kamigata rakugo is comic storytelling mostly performed in the areas around the prefectures of Osaka and Kyoto.
Kamigata rakugo is comic storytelling mostly performed in the areas around the prefectures of Osaka and Kyoto.
Kamigata rakugo is comic storytelling mostly performed in the areas around the prefectures of Osaka and Kyoto.

sen.j: 「上方落語」という言葉は、花月亭九里丸著書の『寄席楽屋事典』によると、1932年（昭和7年）7月1日発行の雑誌『上方』十九号で初めて使われた。
sen.e: According to "Yose Gakuya Jiten" (Dictionary of Backstage Slang in Rakugo Theatre) by Kurimaru KAGETSUTEI, the term, 'Kamigata rakugo,' first appeared in the 19th issue of the journal "Kamigata" published on July 1, 1932.

According to "Yose Gakuya Jiten" (Dictionary of Backstage Slang in the Rakugo Theatre) by Kurimaru KAGETSUTEI, the term, 'Kamigata rakugo,' first appeared in the nineteenth issue of the journal "Kamigata" published on July 1, 1932.

sen.j: それまでは「大阪落語」、「京都落語」と呼ばれていた。
sen.e: Until then it was called 'Osaka rakugo' or 'Kyoto rakugo.'

sen.j: 現在では京都落語が衰えてしまったので、大阪落語のことを指して上方落語と呼んでいる。
sen.e: Today Kamigata rakugo refers to Osaka rakugo as the Kyoto counterpart died out.

sen.j: 江戸時代中期に、京都の露の五郎兵衛初代や大阪の米沢彦八初代が道端に舞台を設け、自作の噺を披露して銭を稼いだ。
sen.e: In the mid Edo period TSUYU no Gorobe I in Kyoto and Hikohachi YONEZAWA I in Osaka set up a stage wayside to perform comic stories of their own making for money.

sen.j: この「辻咄」（つじばなし）や「軽口」（かるくち）とよばれるものが落語の起源といわれている。
sen.e: Called 'Tsuji-banashi' (storytelling at crossroads) or 'Karukuchi' (humorous stories), this is believed to have been the origin of rakugo.

sen.j: 寛政から文化 (元号)にかけては浄瑠璃作家から転じた芝屋芝艘や、京都から大阪へ下って御霊などの社地で噺を演じた松田彌助が台頭。
sen.e: From the Kansei to the Bunka period, the following storytellers were popular: Shibaso SHIBAYA who had composed joruri (dramatic narratives chanted to shamisen accompaniment) before he became a teller of comic stories as well as Yasuke MATSUDA who, moving from Kyoto to Osaka, performed comic stories in shrines and temples such as Mitama-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 落とし噺（狭義の落語）と並んで江戸落語の軸を成す人情噺（狭義の人情噺。内容が講談に近く、落ちがない。「牡丹灯籠」、「文七元結」、「真景累ヶ淵」など）は、上方落語には存在しないと言ってよい。
sen.e: Kamigata rakugo does not treat sentimental routines which constitute the axis of Edo rakugo alongside 'otoshi banashi' (rakugo in the strict sense), (and which refer to the humane stories in the strictest sense of the term and are closer to kodan storytelling without a final punch line as in 'Peony Lantern,' 'Bunshichi's Barber Shop,' 'The Spine-Chiller in Kasanegafuchi).

sen.j: この差異に関して「上方では浄瑠璃（文楽）が確固たる地位を築いていたので、落語が人情噺を受け持つ必然性が薄かったからだろう」と桂米朝は述べている。
sen.e: Beicho KATSURA said of this difference, 'Kamigata rakugo had little or no reason to tell sentimental stories which were dealt with by puppet theatre that was firmly established in Kamigata.'

sen.e: For this reason, the problem of 'the rivalries among entertainment companies,' which is common among stand-up or slapstick comedians, or which causes difficulties in assigning personalities to TV programs, is not so conspicuous, if not nonexistent, in the rakugo industry.

tit.j: 明治から昭和初期まで
tit.e: From the Meiji to the early Showa Period
From Meiji to the early Showa Period
From Meiji to the early Showa period

sen.j: 明治時代から昭和初期の大阪市内、特にミナミ法善寺周辺には、北側に三友派の象徴であった「紅梅亭」（旧称「今嘉の席」「泉熊の席」、後に吉本興業が買収し「西花月亭」）があった。
sen.e: From the Meiji to the early Showa period, there was 'Kobaitei Theatre' (which had been previously known as 'Imaga no Seki' or 'Izukuma no Seki', and which was subsequently acquired by Yoshimoto Kogyo and was renamed 'West Kagetsutei Theatre') that epitomized the Sanyu school of rakugo in the northern part of South Osaka around the Hozen-ji Temple in Osaka City.

From Meiji to the early Showa period, there was the 'Kobaitei Theatre' (previously known as 'Imaga no Seki' or 'Izukuma no Seki', subsequently acquired by Yoshimoto Kogyo and was renamed 'West Kagetsutei Theatre') that epitomized the Sanyu school of rakugo in the northern part of South Osaka around the Hozen-ji Temple in Osaka City.

sen.j: 南側に桂派の象徴であった「南地金沢亭」（同じく吉本の買収後「南地花月」）が存在した。
sen.e: Embodying the Katsura school, 'Nanchi Kanazawatei Theatre' (which became 'Nanchi Kagetsu Theatre after it was bought by Yoshimoto Kogyo) existed in the southern part of South Osaka.

sen.j: 他にもキタ北新地の「永楽館」（同じく吉本の買収後「北新地花月倶楽部」）はじめ、上本町、堀江 (大阪市)、松屋町、新町 (大阪市)、松島遊廓、大阪天満宮界隈などに十数軒の落語専門定席が存在していた。

sen.j: 天満宮の「第二文芸館」（同じく吉本の買収後「天満花月吉川館」）を皮切りに順次吉本に買収された事により、次第に漫才中心の興行内容にシフトしていった。
sen.e: Starting with 'Daini Bungei Kan Theatre' (later 'Tenman Kagetsu Yoshikawa Kan' after its takeover by Yoshimoto Kogyo) in Tenman-gu, these were purchased one after another by Yoshimoto Kogyo and gradually shifted to stand-up comedies.

sen.j: 太平洋戦争時は戦地への慰問や落語家の高齢化に伴い寄席も一日4時間ほどしか開演していなかった。
sen.e: During the Pacific War, the rakugo theatres were open only four hours a day, partly because many storytellers entertained the soldiers at fronts, and partly because they were advanced in years.

sen.j: 1947年、ミナミに「戎橋松竹」（通称「戎松」）が開場。

sen.j: その後も戎松の後身の「千日劇場」や、松竹芸能系の「道頓堀角座」「演芸の浪花座」（道頓堀）「新花月」（新世界 (大阪)）、吉本興業系の「なんば花月」「うめだ花月」、東宝系でケーエープロダクションの芸人が多く出演した「トップホットシアター」が開場。
sen.e: The following theatres then opened in Osaka: 'Sennichi Gekijo Theatre' which developed from 'Ebisu Matsu,' Shochiku Geino's theatres, 'Dotonbori Kadoza,' 'Engei no Naniwaza' (in Dotonbori) and 'Shinkagetsu' (in Shinsekai, Osaka), Yoshimoto Kogyo's 'Nanba Kagetsu,' 'Umeda Kagetsu,' and Toho's 'Top Hot Theatre' where many performers of KA Production appeared.

sen.j: 京都・新京極には「富貴 (寄席)」「京洛劇場」「京都花月劇場」ができた。
sen.e: In Shinkyogoku, Kyoto Prefecture, 'Fuki (Yose) Theatre,' Kyoraku Theatre' and 'Kyoto Kagetsu Theatre' opened.

sen.e: In front of Hyogo Station in Kobe 'Yose Palace Theatre' was opened and in Shinkaichi 'Kobe Shochikuza Theatre' opened.

sen.j: 落語専門定席の不在が上方落語の滅亡につながる事を懸念した上方落語協会は、会長・笑福亭松鶴の主導の下、中央区 (大阪市)千年町の島之内教会を借りて、1972年（昭和47年）2月より、月5日の「島之内寄席」を開催。
sen.e: Concerned that the absence of a theatre dedicated to rakugo might lead to the loss of Kamigata rakugo, the Kamigata Rakugo Association under the initiative of the Chairman Shokaku SHOFUKUTEI held 'Shimanouchi Yose Theatre' five days a month, beginning in February 1972 at the Shimanouchi Church in Sennen-cho, Chuo Ward (Osaka Prefecture)

sen.j: 芸能事務所や放送局（当時、一部の名のある落語家は放送局と専属契約を交わしていた）の枠を超えた定席として位置づけた。
sen.e: The association identified the Shimanouchi Yose Theatre as rakugo-specific theatre where storytellers of all affiliations, whether entertainment companies or TV stations (with which famous storytellers had exclusive contracts), could perform.

sen.j: だが、会場側の都合によりわずか2年で潰えてしまう。

sen.j: その後「島之内寄席」は会場を転々とし、1974年（昭和49年）4月にブラザーミシンビル（心斎橋）、同年12月に船場センタービル地下のボウリング場、1975年（昭和50年）6月にはダイエー京橋店へと移り、月3日興行に短縮された。
sen.e: Subsequently, the Shimanouchi Yose Theatre moved to various places: Brother Mishin Building (in Shinsaibashi) in April, 1974, the bowling stadium in the basement of Senba Center Building in December 1974, Daiei Kyobashi Store in June 1975 where the performance period was shortened to three days a month.

sen.e: In April 1984 the Shimanouchi Theatre moved to a Japanese restaurant called 'Shibaraku' in Tatamiya-machi, Minami Ward, thus returning to 'Shimanouchi.'

sen.e: Only three years later, however, 'Shibaraku' was shut down for refurbishment, so in 1987 the Theatre moved to CB College in Shinsaibashi, where a performance was given only one day a month.

sen.e: After moving to Isshinji Theatre in Tennoji in 1993, the Shimanouchi Yose Theatre moved to the lesson room of the Osaka Prefectural Museum of Kamigata Comedy and Performing Arts which opened in 1996.

sen.j: 結果として、現在、国立文楽劇場小ホールで奇数月に開かれている「上方演芸特選会」として実を結んだ。
sen.e: This resulted in 'Kamigata Engei Special Program' held at the small hall of the National Bunraku Theatre in the odd months.

sen.j: だが、年間6回のみの興行であり、定席と呼ぶにはほど遠かった。
sen.e: Yet the program was held only 6 times a year, far from being called regular rakugo theatre.

sen.j: その後も専門定席の構想が浮上しては消えていった。
sen.e: After that the idea of creating a theatre devoted to rakugo resurfaced but in vain.

sen.j: 上方落語協会が桂三枝体制に入ると具体化し、2006年（平成18年）9月15日に「天満天神繁昌亭」が大阪天満宮境内北側に開席。
sen.e: When Sanshi KATSURA became Chairman of the Kamigata Rakugo Association, it was finally materialized as 'Tenma Tenjin Hanjotei Theatre' which was opened in the northern part of the Osaka Tenman-gu Shrine's precincts on September 15, 2006.

sen.j: 「島之内寄席」が島之内教会を離れて32年、大阪大空襲から61年を経て落語専門定席は名実共に復活した。
sen.e: Thirty-two years after the Shimanouchi Yose Theatre left the Shimanouchi Church and 61 years after the Osaka Air Raid, the rakugo theatre was finally restored both in form and content.
Thirty-two years after the Shimanouchi Yose Theatre left the Shimanouchi Church and sixty-one years after the Osaka Air Raid, the rakugo theatre was finally restored both in form and content.

sen.j: 現在、上方落語協会ではキタの天満天神繁昌亭とミナミの島之内寄席を、協会主催寄席の両輪と位置づけている。
sen.e: Currently, the Kamigata Rakugo Association identifies the Tenma Tenjin Hanjotei Theatre in North Osaka and the Shimanouchi Yose Theatre in South as two wheels of yose theatre that it organizes.

sen.j: なお、純然たる落語専門定席ではないが、「なんばグランド花月」、「B1角座」などの演芸場でも落語のプログラムが組み込まれている。
sen.e: Rakugo programs are given as part of performances at various engei halls like 'Nanba Grand Kagetsu' and 'B1 Kadoza,' which are not genuine rakugo theatres.

sen.j: 吉本興業や松竹芸能に所属する落語家が独演会や勉強会を行うことがある。
sen.e: Rakugo storytellers who belong to Yoshimoto Kogyo and Shochiku Geino hold solo shows or workshops.

sen.j: 千日前のトリイホールで毎月1日に開かれている「TORII寄席」は、米朝事務所所属の落語家が多く出演する。
sen.e: 'Torii Yose' held once a month at Torii Hall in Sennichimae invites many storytellers who belong to Office Beicho.

sen.e: The success of the Tenma Tenji Hanjotei Theatre in part helped the programmers to consider rakugo in new light.

sen.j: 2008年、なんばグランド花月で落語家のみの興行が定期的に行われるようになった。
sen.e: In 2008 Nanba Grand Kagetsu began to hold a regular program where only rakugo storytellers appeared.

sen.j: その他にも吉本興業は「うめだ花月」で月曜日から金曜まで昼の時間（12：30から）のみ「花花寄席」題して吉本所属・フリーの若手中心で構成されたプログラムを行なっている。
sen.e: Yoshimoto Kogyo offers a rakugo program entitled 'Hanahana Yose' which is held every afternoon (starting at 12:30) from Monday to Friday at 'Umeda Kagetsu,' and where young performers who either belong to Yoshimoto Kogyo or are free-lancers appear.

sen.j: 現在は「うめだ花月」の閉館で「なんばグランド花月」内にある「ヨシモト∞ホール大阪」で毎週土曜に開催。

sen.j: 1972年（昭和47年）8月から1992年（平成4年）8月まで桂米之助 (3代目)が主宰した「岩田寄席」（東大阪市）がその始まりとされる。
sen.e: The practice began with 'Iwata Yose' (in Higashiosaka City) which continued from August 1972 to August 1992 under the initiative of Yonenosuke KATSURA (III).

sen.j: 1974年（昭和49年）7月に始まった旭堂南陵主宰の「堺おたび寄席」（堺市、2005年3月に中断したが場所を代えて復活、講談と落語の会）と同年9月から続く「田辺寄席」（大阪市、桂文太と世話人会が運営）は最古参。
sen.e: The oldest are the following two: 'Sakai Otabi Yose' (Sakai City) which Nanryo KYOKUDO began in July 1974 (and which was suspended in March 2005 and was later revived in a different place, offering kodan and rakugo storytelling) and 'Tanabe Yose' which began in September 1974 and continues to this day, (held in Osaka City and run by Bunta KATSURA and his friends).

sen.j: 「もとまち寄席恋雅亭」（神戸市、世話人は桂春駒）、「桂米朝落語研究会」（京都市東山区、桂米朝一門主宰）「尼崎落語研究会」（尼崎市、桂米朝一門主宰）、「京都市民寄席」（京都市）をはじめ数多く行われる。
sen.e: There are many other programs, including 'Motomachi Yose Rengatei' (held by Harukoma KATSURA in Kobe City), 'Beicho KATSURA Rakugo Workshop' (held by the Beicho KATSURA family in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City), 'Amagasaki Rakugo Workshop' (organized by the Beicho KATSURA family in Amagasaki City) and 'Kyoto Citizen's Yose' (in Kyoto City).
